__data__.text:
Public Works Commission
Agenda Report

Public Works
Commission Meeting
03-24-21
Item
4.A.

To:

Chair Merrick and Members of the Public Works Commission

Prepared by:

Robert DuBoux, Public Works Director/City Engineer

Date prepared: March 18, 2021

Meeting date: March 24, 2021

Subject:

Capital Improvement Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects Status
Report

RECOMMENDED ACTION: Receive and file report on the status of the City’s current and
upcoming Capital Improvements Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects.

DISCUSSION: Staff will provide a status update on the following active projects in the
Fiscal Year 2020-2021 Capital Improvement Program:

Capital Improvement Projects (Design)

Marie Canyon Green Streets
(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The City has recently received Measure W funds to complete this
project. Staff is working on the project plans to prepare for public
bidding.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: April 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

PCH Median Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Consultant is working on the final design. In March, the City be
to perform construction

from consultants

seeking proposals
management.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Page 1 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) 65% design package was submitted to Caltrans in November 2020.
(cid:131) Consultant is working on final design documents.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Final Design: May 2021
(cid:131) Advertise: July 2021
(cid:131) Award Contract and Begin Construction: September 2021

Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) A Los Angeles County Flood Control maintenance agreement is
required for this project. Staff is waiting for the County’s approval of
the agreement.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Completed. Awaiting maintenance agreement from

the County.

(cid:131) Begin Construction: Estimated Summer 2021

Westward Beach Road Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project requires coordination with Los Angeles County Beaches
and Harbor. Staff is working out the final details of the project with
the County and will be finalizing the design.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Civic Center Water Treatment Facility Phase 2

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Project is at the 65% design phase.
(cid:131) The City obtained a project CDP from Planning Commission on

February 1, 2021.

(cid:131) The State is reviewing the City’s application for the State Revolving

Fund program.

(cid:131) The project assessment engineer has begun

the process of

evaluating the project costs.

(cid:131) Staff is rescheduling the community meeting to April 2021.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: December 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: March 2022

Page 2 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

Malibu Park Drainage Improvements

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Staff is making minor modifications to the project plans to reduce the

overall project costs.

(cid:131) Project is out to bid with bids due April 16, 2021.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: March 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: June 2021

Capital Improvement Projects (Construction)

City Hall Roof Replacement

(cid:190) Updates: The City has held project meetings with the contractor and is

developing a project schedule.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: February – May 2021

Bluffs Park Workout Station

(cid:190) Updates: The contractor has received the workout equipment and is working

on the installation.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: November 2020 – March 2021

Civic Center Way Improvements

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Work Hours: Monday through Friday 7:00AM to 4:00PM, Saturdays

7:00AM to 4:00PM

(cid:131) Phase 1 of the temporary closure on Civic Center Way between Vista
Pacifica and the private driveway of 23901 Civic Center Way has
been opened to local residential traffic only.

(cid:131) Phase 2 remains closed in both directions between the entry to

Malibu Cyn Village condos to Webb Way.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: August 2020 through April 2021

Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started)

Annual Street Maintenance

(cid:190) Project Description: This project provides for the reconstruction and

maintenance of City streets.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2021

Bluffs Park Shade Structure

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of the installation of four single-

post shade structures at Malibu Bluffs Park

Page 3 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Vehicle Protection Devices

(cid:190) Project Description: Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces
located adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area. There are two
locations within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would
require a vehicle impact protection device.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Malibu Road Slope Repairs

(cid:190) Project Description: The existing slope adjacent to the beach access stairs
at 24712 Malibu Road has been eroded and caused damage to Malibu
Road.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Fall 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

Disaster Projects (Design)

Broad Beach Road Water Quality Infrastructure Repairs

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of the project.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Latigo Canyon Road Roadway/Retaining Wall Improvements (FEMA/CalOES
Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Staff is finalizing the design of this project.
(cid:131) Staff is also working with FEMA/CalOES to substitute the existing

timber with non-combustible materials.

(cid:190) Project Schedule

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2021

Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of this project.

Page 4 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer/Fall 2021

Trancas Canyon Park Slope Stabilization Project (CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of this project.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer/Fall 2021

Birdview Avenue Improvements (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The design of this project has been included in the Malibu Park
Drainage Improvements project and updates will be provided under
that project.

Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA after the
Wooley Fire. The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop a plan
that includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations. Staff
is working on an RFQ to hire a consultant for the design.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Unknown

Disaster Projects (Construction)
None at this time

Disaster Projects (Completed)
Guardrail Replacement Citywide (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged

guardrail throughout the City as a result of the Woolsey Fire.

Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing fire damaged
existing fencing and repairing the damaged embankment adjacent to the
bridge.

Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing a portion of Corral

Canyon Road that was damaged from a failed storm drain.

Disaster Projects (Not Started)
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

Page 5 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a
few storm drains on Clover Heights. The existing storm drain facility ends at
the intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road. During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road. An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2022
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2022

Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing the existing storm
drain on Latigo Canyon Road located approximately 2,500 feet from PCH
that was damaged by the Woolsey Fire.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Winter 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Spring 2022

Encinal Canyon Road Drainage Improvements (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing damage storm drain
facilities and roadway embankments that were damaged by the Woolsey
Fire.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Winter 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Spring 2022

Storm Drain Master Plan (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA
after the Woolsey Fire. The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Completion Date: Spring 2022

Page 6 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.
